Text: 77 years ago today, Operation Detachment, the code name for the 36-day American invasion and capture of the Japanese island of Iwo Jima, was underway. Hershel "Woody" Williams earned the Medal of Honor for his heroic actions during this battle that changed the course of history. https://t.co/s4pFMbqSvJ

Around 43% of Medicare beneficiaries in West Virginia rely on Medicare Advantage plans for their healthcare, which is why I led 63 bipartisan Senators in urging @CMSGov to keep supporting the Medicare Advantage program. https://t.co/cI1Z32qc5i

The 45th United States Colored Troops was the only regiment in the Civil War composed of Black soldiers accredited to the new state of West Virginia. The motto ‚ÄúOne Cause, One Country‚Äù adorns the 45th‚Äôs banner. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/RVfyWQZyub https://t.co/YXnUuB9ZIM

I applaud this long-overdue news. Whether it‚Äôs on the pitch or in an office, women deserve equal pay for equal work. I introduced a bill to secure equal pay for @USWNT in 2019, and I will continue fighting for them until they get the equal pay they deserve https://t.co/pl5XwpDIHa

West Virginians have always made tremendous sacrifices & done the heavy lifting that built our nation. New investments coming to our state will allow us to recognize these enormous contributions & reinvest in our communities. Read more in my op-ed here: https://t.co/oTAV4vIVP3

It was one of the greatest honors of my lifetime to be presented the State Funeral For WWII Veterans George Marshall Award by Woody Williams, the last living WWII Medal of Honor recipient. I'm proud to help & support our Veterans because they have given so much for our freedoms. https://t.co/z1eQJcX7ie

Carter G. Woodson graduated from Frederick Douglass High School in Huntington & later became its principal. As director of the Association for the Study of Negro Life and History, Woodson launched Negro History Week in 1926, which is now #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/dtp6HY1w8d https://t.co/XXeGe3RDFa

Finally, I toured @SmoothAmbler's distillery and tasting room in Maxwelton. Smooth Ambler uses state-of-the-art equipment & Greenbrier County's cool climate to produce unique spirits that can be found on shelves all across the country. https://t.co/Rg7ZKkTDOG

Next, I toured the West Virginia Great Barrel Company @WvBarrel, which produces white oak barrels with locally-sourced lumber and ships them to distilleries all over the world. Founded in 2017, this growing business in White Sulphur Springs has created 100 new jobs. https://t.co/cC8WRIrPBS

Today I visited White Sulphur Springs where I took a tour of The Schoolhouse Hotel, which will be the first ever ADA fully-accessible hotel in the U.S. Following the devastation of the 2016 flood, downtown White Sulphur Springs is thriving with new businesses! #WhiteSulphurStrong https://t.co/aUoBOnFFsP

Booker T. Washington grew up in Malden where he attended a one-room school for Black children. After the Civil War, Washington became the first principal of Tuskegee Normal and Industrial School & went on to be a famed author & orator. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/nxfrsNDknq https://t.co/8uG0PLa26o
In honor of #BlackHistoryMonth, I‚Äôm highlighting people and places that have left a lasting mark on our state and country. Follow along this week as we celebrate West Virginia‚Äôs Black history.

I'm a proud supporter of #WV's public schools, and I'm glad that the Senate unanimously passed a resolution I cosponsored designating Feb. 21-25 as #PublicSchoolsWeek! Thank you to our teachers, administrators & school service personnel for all that you do for WV's youth. https://t.co/AyBTiTYCea

I'm proud to be working together with @SenCapito @RepMcKinley and @WVGovernor to help #WV secure a #HydrogenHub that will create jobs, develop clean energy & invest billions of dollars into our economy. From @NewsandSentinel: https://t.co/4xNC0AKFAg

I am encouraged by the framework that was recently agreed upon, and I urge my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to continue to work toward a compromise on FY22 funding to avoid yet another extension that hurts the American people and our priorities.
We have a responsibility to prevent economic catastrophe for the American people on top of the unprecedented COVID-19 pandemic.

Avoiding a federal government shutdown in the middle of a pandemic and agreeing to a reasonable budget must continue to be our top priority. Tonight I voted for a short-term federal budget extension through March 11th to keep the government open during these critical times.

GOOD NEWS: The Health Care for Burn Pit Veterans Act, which provides healthcare for Veterans exposed to burn pits during deployments to the Middle East and Afghanistan, has unanimously passed the Senate! I was proud to lead this fight for #WV Veterans. https://t.co/l9ipM8bfjG

Today I led seven Senators in calling on @TheJusticeDept to investigate whether members of the Sackler family personally engaged in criminal conduct in connection with Purdue Pharma‚Äôs admitted criminal wrongdoing in fueling the devastating opioid epidemic. https://t.co/WhPIL8Pqgc

In December, @SecBecerra and I toured @WVURNI and learned more about this groundbreaking research. Their efforts are crucial to addressing the drug epidemic that has killed more than 100,000 Americans and more than 1,600 West Virginians in the last year. https://t.co/TTkxiC0Uj3

WATCH: @WVURNI is making progress on an experimental treatment that is helping doctors better understand substance use disorder & predict when patients will relapse. I'm proud to support this research that is helping us fight back against the drug epidemic https://t.co/mH0O4H8fu8

Mercer County Commissioner Greg Puckett shared that ‚Äúa long-term plan to address our state‚Äôs drug epidemic could cost tens of billions of dollars. With the continued impact of the COVID-19 pandemic and record rates of drug overdoses, this number is heartbreaking for WV families.‚Äù

Wyoming County also had 293 overdoses & 36 deaths in 2021. Despite this, Kenneth Birchfield with the Southern Highlands Community Mental Health Center refuses to give up: ‚ÄúOur work is not done, but I am proud of the work that Wyoming County does every day.‚Äù

Charles Rowe w/ Southern Highlands Community Mental Health Center reports that in 2021, McDowell Co saw 240 total overdoses & 35 deaths. W/ more overdoses due to fentanyl & decreases in manpower & funding, Sheriff Boomer Muncy sees ‚Äúnothing but increases to our current problems.‚Äù

Tera from Fayette County has watched her brother and nephew battle substance use disorder for years: ‚ÄúI talked my nephew into going to rehab. He stayed one night and signed himself out the next morning‚Ä¶I just don‚Äôt want to have to bury my nephew.‚Äù

Elizabeth‚Äôs cousin developed substance use disorder after an ATV accident that left him injured & with an unrestricted opioid prescription. Now Elizabeth fights the opioid epidemic on the ground at West Virginia Prevention Solutions in Clarksburg. Her full letter here: https://t.co/IkDJv5MIlp

Yesterday I spoke against Dr. Califf‚Äôs confirmation to lead the FDA & told the story of Lauren Cole, a bright West Virginian who died from a drug overdose in 2020. I've received many stories from West Virginians on the devastating impact the drug epidemic has had. THREAD: https://t.co/vsTH0bYt9Y
@US_FDA https://t.co/WjPMBqwtzf

Dr. Califf has been FDA Commissioner for mere hours and his first order of business was installing someone who bears more responsibility for the opioid epidemic than any other member of the federal government. But that‚Äôs not a surprise given how he previously led the @US_FDA.

WATCH: I went to the floor again to urge my colleagues to vote against Dr. Califf‚Äôs confirmation to lead @US_FDA. 400,000 Americans died since he was there last & we're going down the same path now. We need someone who will take us forward, not backward. https://t.co/rxxuwmeKzM

Our West Virginia Hydrogen Hub Working Group is the first step in competing and being selected to become a hydrogen hub, and I look forward to working closely with my colleagues to sell all that our great state has to offer to the rest of the nation.

@ENERGY I am proud to be working with my colleagues @SenCapito @RepMcKinley & @WVGovernor to collaborate on this incredible opportunity to showcase how WV can continue to lead the country ‚Äì and the world ‚Äì in advancing energy technologies and bring good-paying jobs to the state.

GOOD NEWS: I‚Äôm proud to announce the launch of the #WV Hydrogen Hub Working Group to collaborate and support a strong WV candidate to be chosen to develop a hydrogen hub, funded through $9.5B allocated to @ENERGY by the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. MORE: https://t.co/kvHXw6sQA7
@NTIAgov Read our full letter here: https://t.co/y4VOeNJEp5

Today I led 16 bipartisan Senators in encouraging @NTIAgov Assistant Secretary Alan Davidson to follow Congressional intent in implementing the $65B included in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law for broadband. MORE: https://t.co/oiKutidiiD
I will vote NO on Dr. Califf‚Äôs nomination and I have never been more profoundly confident of a vote I am going to cast than I am right now.

WATCH: On this #ValentinesDay, my heart breaks for the families of more than 400,000 Americans and 5,000 West Virginians who have died from a drug related overdose in the five years since Dr. Robert Califf was confirmed to lead the FDA. https://t.co/Va6aR4N6mx

It's time for the @federalreserve to stop pussyfooting around & tackle inflation head-on. We all have a responsibly to do all that is possible to roll back inflation & manage our debts. The longer we or the Federal Reserve waits to act, the more economic pain will be caused. https://t.co/QdbWc3MJJx

No matter the season, @CapitolMarketWV in Charleston has unique, #WV-made gifts and fresh foods from locally-owned small businesses. Glad I could catch up with executive director Evan Osborn during my trip to the Market this morning! https://t.co/VqaJWQNPHS

GOOD NEWS: Toyota has announced a $73M investment in its Buffalo, #WV plant to increase hybrid transaxle production, bringing their total investment in the Buffalo plant to $533M in the last 12 months. I applaud Toyota's commitment to growing their business in the Mountain State. https://t.co/xUIOltM978

We need an FDA commissioner who is suited to handle the public health challenges our entire country is facing, including the drug epidemic. That is not Dr. Robert Califf. Read more in my op-ed with @SenatorBraun in @USATODAY: https://t.co/INadJwplt8

West Virginians are feeling the impacts of inflation in nearly every part of their lives. We must get serious about the finances of our country. How is inflation impacting you and your family? https://t.co/zvdUM4AVuS

Congratulations to PRIDE Community Services, Inc. of WV, one of 20 winners nationwide of a @HRSAgov competition to develop programs to improve pediatric health outcomes. I applaud these efforts to ensure our children are healthy & vaccinated! https://t.co/A2QnycRWpi

Today @HELPCmteDems will consider the nomination of Christopher Williamson to lead @MSHA_DOL. Chris is a proud Mingo County native & knows there's nothing more important than ensuring our miners come home safe every day. I fully support his nomination & wish him the best of luck!
My statement on consumer inflation rising to 7.5%, the largest 12 month increase in four decades: https://t.co/67RizZR20u

I'm proud to cosponsor the Violence Against Women Act, an overdue renewal of protections for our sisters, daughters & neighbors. I look forward to voting for this important bipartisan legislation. https://t.co/0lDHKsGzJM

Did you know that the first woman to play professional baseball full-time was a West Virginian? Toni Stone was born in Bluefield in 1921, and went on to play baseball for the Indianapolis Clowns. Toni is featured today on the home page of @google! #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/xZWPTlqoaY
It was an honor to speak with members of the @WVNationalGuard in Washington today. Please join me in thanking them for their service to our state and our country üá∫üá∏ https://t.co/53OmBOA4Gr

WATCH: I'm a proud West Virginia Democrat. I work for the people of West Virginia, and they want common sense ideas & bipartisanship in Washington. That's why I work across the aisle each and every day to find bipartisan solutions to the issues facing West Virginia & our country. https://t.co/dWp5w9X4zj

On Feb. 7, 1867, the West Virginia Legislature created the Agricultural College of West Virginia - better known to us today as West Virginia University. Happy 155th birthday to my alma mater, @WestVirginiaU! üéâ https://t.co/83jtC1FvQW

My friend Henry C. "Hoppy" Shores loved Kanawha County, and his decades of dedicated public service will have a lasting impact on our state. Please join Gayle and I in praying for his family, friends, and Kanawha County Commission colleagues as they mourn this incredible loss.

Amtrak provides a critical service in #WV, and the loss of our ticket agent made it more difficult for West Virginians to use the train - especially those with limited connectivity. I was proud to secure legislation that reinstated #WV's lone ticket agent. https://t.co/6DB2YNubh0

Today I'm wearing red to raise awareness for heart health during #AmericanHeartMonth. West Virginia has one of the highest rates of heart disease in the nation. I urge all West Virginians to create good habits to keep you & your family healthy. @AHA_WV https://t.co/bzDlhZFsQe

This is yet another example of why we must have new, dedicated leadership at the FDA that understands the gravity of the drug epidemic and will fight back against the greed of the pharmaceutical industry. Dr. Robert Califf is not that leader. https://t.co/OuiCXkMyse

I made my concerns about this drug clear to HHS nearly 8 years ago. Since then, #WV has been ravaged by the drug epidemic, with 1,607 drug-related overdose deaths from Apr '20 to Apr '21 alone, while pharmaceutical companies made billions. https://t.co/T5uYTuNi0i

Zohydro has finally been pulled from the market eight years after its controversial approval. But this prescription opioid never should have been approved in the first place because of its high potential for misuse. https://t.co/GGu78bGD0f

Some estimates suggest that there are as many as 900K WVians without reliable broadband access. That's why I questioned Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo on the implementation of the $65B for broadband expansion in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill. It's time to get #WV connected https://t.co/skNVCv7w9e

I‚Äôm proud to celebrate West Virginia‚Äôs rich Black history and highlight African American West Virginians who have made contributions that are still felt across our state and beyond. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/M8ZQUfda52
If you or someone you know is in need of assistance with a state or federal agency, please contact my office at 304-342-5855. My staff and I are always ready to help fellow West Virginians!

WATCH: It was an honor to assist Mrs. Vernon Young, of Charleston, in obtaining replacement medals earned by her late husband, Kester, who served in the U.S. Army during World War II as a Communications Chief from 1942 to 1944. Watch to learn more about this wonderful family. https://t.co/nyopUHoMkh

Applications are now open for the HIRE Vets Medallion Program, which recognizes employers for their investments in recruiting, employing & retaining Veterans. I was proud to lead legislation to create this program in 2017. Visit https://t.co/rP5fMfZhrU to learn more & apply today
Have you ordered your free #COVID19 rapid tests yet? Every American household is eligible to order up to four free tests. Visit https://t.co/0ypIDVrUzi to order your free tests today.

#ICYMI: I visited the #WV Capitol this week & had the privilege of addressing my friends & former colleagues on the House & Senate floors. I was also able to meet West Virginians visiting the Capitol from all over the state! https://t.co/5vSqKSUQE9

Today we honor the millions of innocent lives lost in the Holocaust. We must never forget these atrocities, and we must continue to stand up against hate and antisemitism. #NeverAgain #HolocaustRemembranceDay

I take my Constitutional responsibility to advise and consent on a nominee to the Supreme Court very seriously. I look forward to meeting with and evaluating the qualifications of President Biden‚Äôs nominee to fill this Supreme Court vacancy.
Justice Breyer has dedicated much of his life to upholding the rule of law and we are grateful for his service. I wish him a happy and fulfilling retirement.

After my visit, I called HHS Secretary Xavier Becerra to urge him to allocate these treatments to vulnerable states like WV. These treatments are essential, and I will continue to push HHS & the Biden Admin. to allocate these treatments to communities that need them the most. https://t.co/1vGQl1EkMx

West Virginia is working overtime to contain the Omicron surge, but we need the help and support of our federal partners. Today I visited the Kanawha-Charleston Health Department to see firsthand the need for COVID-19 treatments, like monoclonal antibodies. https://t.co/YzM45iHMXa

GOOD NEWS: West Virginia will receive more than $37 million this year, and nearly $200 million over the next five years, from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill this year to help fund Corridor H. MORE: https://t.co/8YnTh2KoWs

Great to be back in @wvhouse and @wvsenate today. I had the chance to talk with so many West Virginians in our Capitol and hear their common sense thoughts and ideas on how we can make our state and country work better. https://t.co/pYKWeoaLsZ
Gayle and I encourage all West Virginians to join us in praying for Zachary‚Äôs family, friends and loved ones as they mourn this incredible loss.

It is tragic to lose someone so young and with so much potential to give back to our country, state and community. PFC Riffle‚Äôs sacrifice is heartbreaking, and we are forever grateful for his service to our nation.

Gayle and I are deeply saddened to hear of the death of Marine Private First Class Zachary Riffle from Kingwood, West Virginia. Our brave servicemembers put themselves in harms way every day to protect their fellow Americans and the values we hold dear.
That‚Äôs why I led voter registration efforts as West Virginia‚Äôs Secretary of State and continue to look for a bipartisan path forward to protect the right to vote for every eligible American.

Coach Saban is exactly right: you cannot throw the filibuster out and expect the legislative process to work better. I wholeheartedly agree with the coaches that "Our democracy is at its best when all Americans are encouraged to participate." https://t.co/a3xAtrbGhh

By getting tested for COVID-19, you can protect the people around you and your loved ones. I encourage all West Virginians to visit https://t.co/fyEZHbQyVI where you can order up to four free at-home COVID-19 tests & help #StopTheSpread. https://t.co/fyEZHbQyVI

Today is the LAST DAY for West Virginians without health insurance to apply for coverage during the Affordable Care Act (ACA) Open Enrollment Period. I encourage every West Virginian without health insurance to visit https://t.co/UbtAwqrV7S to find a plan today.
Gayle and I, along with all West Virginians, send our sympathies and prayers to Jeffrey‚Äôs family and loved ones as they mourn this incredible loss.

We are forever grateful our miners put their lives on the line every day to power our great nation. Jeffrey served our state and our country during his time in the mines, and his sacrifices will never be forgotten.

Gayle and I are deeply saddened to hear of the death of Jeffrey A. Phillips at the Ohio County Mine. His family, friends and loved ones are in our prayers and we ask all West Virginians to join us during this difficult time.

GOOD NEWS: More than $500 MILLION will be invested into #WV's bridges over 5 years thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill. This funding will address our crumbling bridges to ensure every West Virginian is driving on safe roads, bridges & highways. https://t.co/46heBBrKxv
It‚Äôs time the FDA had leadership willing to step forward to protect Americans from the drug epidemic that continues to ravage our nation. Dr. Califf is not that leader.

And when Dr. Califf appeared before the Senate HELP Committee, I made it clear that the FDA needs leadership who will institute a culture change, not continue to fail to keep Americans safe. https://t.co/wxRoct5Z2g

Instead, President Biden nominated Dr. Califf, who has significant ties to the pharmaceutical industry, in November to serve as FDA Commissioner. I strongly opposed his nomination, which is an insult to those who have been impacted by the drug epidemic. https://t.co/BCrITHtYYD

In March of last year, @SenatorHassan and I led 5 of our colleagues in calling on @POTUS to bring new leadership to the FDA to address this crisis that has been exacerbated by the COVID pandemic. https://t.co/7FkkHe8Frx

Americans & West Virginians deserve competent leadership at the @FDA who will take immediate action to address the drug epidemic that has killed more than 100,000 Americans in the last year. https://t.co/UwmXJnOhNs

I joined @SenCapito to welcome @NucorCorp to #WV & reiterate our commitment to working with Nucor, their leadership team and state and federal agencies to help them succeed here in the Mountain State. https://t.co/ikIpBN3wJG

.@NucorCorp's state-of-the-art steel mill will employ West Virginians in good-paying, long-term jobs. Investments from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill have made #WV an even more attractive location to companies like Nucor, ensuring #WV will continue to see major investments.

BIG NEWS: Mason County will be the home of @NucorCorp's new multi-billion dollar steel mill facility, creating thousands of new direct and indirect jobs right here in West Virginia! https://t.co/nBEDu2ZycX
Gayle and I are praying for @WVgovernor‚Äôs full and quick recovery. I hope every West Virginian will get vaccinated and boosted to protect yourself and your loved ones. https://t.co/mzXbY0h7Vj

It‚Äôs not too late to sign up for health insurance at https://t.co/UbtAwqrV7S during the Open Enrollment Period. I encourage every West Virginian without health insurance to visit https://t.co/UbtAwqrV7S to find a plan that works for you and your family before the Jan 15 deadline.

#WestVirginia‚Äôs New River Gorge National Park & Preserve was named as one of @USAToday‚Äôs best places to go with kids in 2022! Visit #WV & see why people from all over the country are visiting America‚Äôs newest National Park. https://t.co/zaCWj31A6F

https://t.co/7SOkneKr8r
Happy New Year! May 2022 bring health and happiness to West Virginia & all of her people. https://t.co/Rjoo5laZ1m

Harry Reid was a quintessential public servant. He served the people of Nevada for decades and was a giant in the United States Senate. My prayers are with his family and friends as they mourn this incredible loss.
Merry Christmas, West Virginia! üéÑ https://t.co/X3I4nwQnXz

As this year comes to a close, let us all reflect on our many blessings as we celebrate with family & loved ones. https://t.co/RR5YXghPit

Senator Isakson was one of the most decent human beings I ever had the pleasure of knowing. His career was one of public service, not self service. Georgia has lost a favorite son and our country has lost a true patriot. My heart is with his family and everyone who loved him.
https://t.co/0fmAXbcRHn

Happy first day of buck firearm season to all of those who are heading into the woods this morning! Wishing everyone a safe & successful hunt. https://t.co/X8vRqCBm6V

As hunting season gets underway in #WV, I urge all hunters to learn the signs of a heart attack or stroke before you head into the woods, and have an emergency plan in place. It could save your life. Read this info from @AHA_WV & practice #HeartHealthyHunting. https://t.co/WoslaqKQb1
